title: Sound shattering then freezing in-game
body:
So I've been running league on windows 10 since a long time and it's been running perfectly fine, until a recent update (It was around 10 August I believe) ruined my league gaming experience. I'm using a brand-new Alienware Intel (R) Core (TM) i5-5200U CPU @ 2.20 GHz, 8 GB Ram (64 bit). When I start the game, I hear weird sound shattering, game doesn't lag or anything it runs smoothly, but when there's a reason for the FPS to drop down (Like opening shop, fighting minions, fighting champions) the game entirely freezes with nothing to do other than force shut down. I've read many threads related to my problem but nothing matched mine. However, I've tried running other high-quality games, even higher qualities than league of legends and much bigger games, they all worked perfectly fine without having a single problem, not even a lag issue, is this normal ?

Things I've tried:

Uninstalling all the updates 
Resetting my whole laptop
Uninstalled the game and downloaded it again for like 3 times

replies.body: I've had the exact same problem and I'm also curious as to how this can be fixed. Please help riot.

With the recent update, you may need to refresh your drivers with a few updates.  There could also be other factors and I appreciate the troubleshooting done so far.  If you had the Windows anniversary update, I've seen reports where players were freezing because of an issue with the[ Xbox Game Bar.](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html)  Disable it, and see if that helps!  

Otherwise, go over the steps in our [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide to help tune up your game!  You can also use our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to help with some automatic processes that the guide may ask for.  Hope that helps!
